sentence.Network_en: Breakfast television arrived in British life precisely a decade ago.
sentence.Network_cn: 准确地说，早间电视节目于10年前进入英国人的生活。

sentence.Network_en: Children come to zoos precisely to see captive animals.
sentence.Network_cn: 孩子们到动物园就是为了看圈养的动物。

sentence.Network_en: "Precisely what other problems do you perceive?" she asked.
sentence.Network_cn: “你究竟还发现了什么问题？”她问道。

example.ex: Nobody knows precisely how many people are still living in the camp...
example.tran: 没有人确切知道还有多少人仍住在露营地。

example.ex: The meeting began at precisely 4.00 p.m...

entry.tran: 正好，恰恰，确实地（表示强调）
entry.def: You can use precisely to emphasize that a reason or fact is the only important one there is, or that it is obvious.

example.ex: Children come to zoos precisely to see captive animals...
example.tran: 孩子们到动物园就是为了看圈养的动物。

example.ex: That is precisely the result the system is designed to produce.
example.tran: 那恰恰是设计该系统时所希望达到的结果。

entry.def: You can say 'precisely'  to confirm in an emphatic way that what someone has just said is true.

example.ex: 'Did you find yourself wondering what went wrong?' — 'Precisely.'
example.tran: “你是不是自己也在想哪儿出了问题？”——“确实如此。”

sentences.sentence: "he was doing precisely (or exactly) what she had told him to do"
"it was just as he said--the jewel was gone"

auth_sentence.content: I am not overly bothered by now knowing precisely.
auth_sentence.res_content: I am not overly bothered by now knowing precisely.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I am not overly bothered by now knowing precisely.

auth_sentence.content: It isn't clear precisely what that evidence is.
auth_sentence.res_content: It isn't clear precisely what that evidence is.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It isn't clear precisely what that evidence is.

auth_sentence.content: But not including them "is precisely wrong".
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But not including them "is precisely wrong".

Sentence.sentence: The sword hasn't had a military function for a hundred years, but is still part of an officer's full-dress uniform, precisely because a sword always symbolized "an officer and a gentleman.
But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason.
Directionally, they capture the trends, but the idea that we know precisely how many are unemployed is a myth.

Precisely because they were working with old-fashioned machines, George Martin and his team of engineers were forced to apply every ounce of their creativity to solve the problems posed to them by Lennon and McCartney.

sentences.en: That answers precisely to our needs.
sentences.cn: 那正好适合我们的需要。

means.word_mean: （加强同意的语气）对，的确如此，一点也不错

sentences.en: So you think we ought to wait here?—Precisely.
sentences.cn: 那么你认为我们应该在这儿等吗?——对。
